DOC.HEAD: Snow And Cold In Northeast
DOC.TEXT: Snow fell Wednesday from the Mississippi Valley to the Appalachians, and temperatures hit record lows in the Northeast. At midday, snow fell over Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, eastern Indiana, eastern Kentucky, Ohio, West Virginia, western Pennsylvania, western New York state and western Virginia. Freezing rain was mixed with the snow over central Indiana, southwestern Lower Michigan and north-central Ohio. Snow also was reported in northwestern North Carolina. The heaviest snowfall during the six hours up to noon was 3 inches at Muskegon, Mich. Record lows were 6 below zero at Binghamton, N.Y.; 13 below at Elkins, W.Va.; and 11 below at Syracuse, N.Y. Huntington, W.Va., tied its record of 4 and Philadelphia tied its record of 8. Wednesday's low for the Lower 48 states was 37 degrees below zero at Watertown, N.Y. The National Weather Service said this has been the coldest December in New York state since 1831. It said the average temperature in Albany for the first 26 days of December was 13.1 degrees, compared to the record of 17.2 degrees set in 1831. In Buffalo, the temperature averaged 16.5 degrees through the day after Christmas, 3 degrees lower than the previous record set in 1876. Temperatures around the nation at 3 p.m. EST ranged from zero at Massena, N.Y., to 75 at Beeville, Texas.
